title: Bard Find Title

metadata.description: Learn about Bard Find Title with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Using Bard to Find a Title
Finding the perfect title for your work isn't easy.
You can use Bard as a creative assistant to help you find ideas for a title
Describe the Work
To help you generate a title, Bard needs context about your work.
Getting specific about context, theme, etc, is important. The more specific you get, the better suggestions you will get.
Example
With the following prompt:
Suggest 10 titles for a short story about a robot posing as a student. It is written from a teenager's perspective, and the robot is almost a perfect copy of a human. They find friends and fall in love. But they still can't solve captchas when browsing the internet.
A response from Bard could be:
We have a list with very different titles to refine and work on.
Refine and Experiment
I like number 2. Let's give Bard a bit more information and work from that:
Example
With the following prompt:
Number 2 suits the story well, as the story is mainly about the robot figuring out how to stay true to its robotic nature but at the same time develop as a human. Based on that, suggest 10 more titles.
A response from Bard could be:
Now you can continue to work with these titles, further refining or taking parts of what you have to make your own.

★
+1
